div.p: According to the general rule, p5 divided by two determines severity. Severity can be taken or mitigated with appropriate skill at base difficulty 20. Determine whether it can be worsened, the full effect is 10. E.g. a severity 5 implies difficulty 25 and only reaching a result of 15 mean full severity and depending on circumstances, a 5 result could mean up to twice the severity effects.

Personal is usually physical penalty. Equipment is usually loss as percentage of net value, e.g. -5 is 5% of value loss. Value is one traveller's net worth. Transport is time loss in percentage. E.g. -5 is 5% time loss until compensated. Plant may mean wilderness skill failure, such as Foraging, with effect equivalent to time or value as before. Animal or human encounters are effectively time loss or wounds. The first one through rhetorics, discussing mute points, detainment, etc.. The second one through exchanging non-lethal blows and being stopped at the right point.
Severity will be 5-added, which is why group travel is generally preferable. GM will "spread" penalties.
Personal: Food poisoning, Airborn, Carrierbite, Contagion, Sprained joint, tissue damage, muscle shear, accident, twisted joint, sunburn, frost.
Equipment: Rust, moisture, breakage, food spoilage, theft, cloths torn, simple loss, transform, transformation.
Transport: Broken wheel, wood rot, shafts, fuel (personal), accident, ditched, deterioration, spirits, frost, fire.
Plant: mushrooms, spores, flowers, herbs, rotten, overgrowth, fire, poisoned, dangerous, spirits, giant, prepared.
Animal: rats, bords, rabbit, wolves, visible, audible, olfactory, tracks, interaction, home, group, young, hunt.
Human: Officials, bandits, merchants, caravans, mercenaries, craftsmen, tracks, other evidence, potential crime scene, fugitive, working, guard, barbarian

Use 5 point classification for Standard, Common, Uncommon, Rare, assuming the skill is used to find the most valuable herb. Standard herbs are those used for teas, tasty chewing, etc. and worth little more than maybe a beer even in large quantities. They provide a bonus of up to 5 for motivation, supress up to 5 physical penalty for a few minutes, etc. Even these small herbs may cause lesser effects over time or even dependency. Think tea or raw coffee.

Add all herbs in one category and randomize. Ater that determine season. Two month out of season reduces potency by half, because the herb is either not ripe or already withered. More than that potency is zero. In border times give 10% for each day. I.e. ten days late or early equals 0%/50% potency and ten days in (out) season equals 50%/100%.
